snippet: The presence of rebel fighters in Syria that were trained and supported by Al Qaeda poses a serious problem for the United States and Western allies.
abstract: Editorial contends presence of rebel fighters in Syria that were trained and supported by Al Qaeda poses serious problem for United States and Western allies;  supports Pres Obama's cautious approach so far, but calls for clearer picture of how he plans to use American influence in dealing with jihadist threat in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The presence of rebel fighters in Syria that were trained and supported by Al Qaeda poses a serious problem for the United States and Western allies.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
